events.originalText: Operatives of the British Special Boat Service boarded the container ship Grande Tema in the Thames Estuary to detain four stowaways who had threatened the crew.
events.subtitle: Special Boat Service
events.headline: British Special Boat Service detains stowaways on Grande Tema ship in Thames Estuary

events.originalText: Countries that were part of the Maya civilization celebrated the end-date of a 5,126-year-long cycle in the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar.
events.subtitle: Maya civilization
events.headline: Maya civilization celebrates end-date of 5,126-year-long cycle

events.originalText: In accordance with the Oslo II Accord, Israeli troops withdrew from Bethlehem in preparation for the transfer of control to the Palestinian National Authority.
events.subtitle: Oslo II Accord
events.headline: Israeli troops withdraw from Bethlehem in accordance with Oslo II Accord

events.originalText: Mexico's Popocatépetl volcano, dormant for 47 years, began erupting, and is now one of the nation's most active volcanoes.
events.subtitle: Popocatépetl
events.headline: Mexico's Popocatépetl volcano erupts after 47 years of dormancy

events.originalText: The world's heaviest aircraft, the Antonov An-225 Mriya, made its first flight.
events.subtitle: Antonov An-225 Mriya
events.headline: Antonov An-225 Mriya makes first flight as world's heaviest aircraft

events.originalText: A bomb on board Pan Am Flight 103 detonated over Lockerbie, Scotland, killing 270 people.
events.subtitle: Pan Am Flight 103
events.headline: Pan Am Flight 103 bomb explosion kills 270 over Lockerbie, Scotland

events.originalText: The Grumman F-14 Tomcat, the primary fighter aircraft of the U.S. Navy for nearly 30 years, made its first flight.
events.subtitle: Grumman F-14 Tomcat
events.headline: Grumman F-14 Tomcat makes first flight as primary U.S. Navy fighter aircraft

events.originalText: Apollo 8 launched from Kennedy Space Center in Florida on a trajectory to the Moon; its crew (pictured) became the first humans to visit another celestial body.
events.subtitle: Apollo 8
events.headline: Apollo 8 launches from Kennedy Space Center to become first humans to visit Moon

events.originalText: The United Nations adopted the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination, which 88 member states have since signed.
events.subtitle: United Nations
events.headline: United Nations adopts International Convention on Elimination of Racial Discrimination

events.originalText: An attempt by Greek Cypriot police to search certain Turkish Cypriot women in Nicosia escalated into island-wide violence, leading to 538 deaths and the displacement of nearly 27,000 people.
events.subtitle: Greek Cypriots
events.headline: Greek Cypriot police search escalates into island-wide violence in Nicosia

events.originalText: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the first full-length cel-animated feature in film history, premiered at the Carthay Circle Theatre in Los Angeles.
events.subtitle: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937 film)
events.headline: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs premieres as first full-length cel-animated feature

events.originalText: Lieutenant Kijé, one of Sergei Prokofiev's best-known works, premiered.
events.subtitle: Lieutenant Kijé (Prokofiev)
events.headline: Lieutenant Kijé, Sergei Prokofiev's work, premieres

events.originalText: Nepal and the United Kingdom signed the first treaty that defined the international status of Nepal as an independent and a sovereign nation.
events.subtitle: Nepal–Britain Treaty of 1923
events.headline: Nepal and UK sign treaty defining Nepal as independent and sovereign nation

events.originalText: After serving two years in prison for encouraging people to resist military conscription, anarchist Emma Goldman was deported from the United States to Russia.
events.subtitle: Draft evasion
events.headline: Anarchist Emma Goldman deported to Russia after serving prison time in the US

events.originalText: HMS Challenger departed Portsmouth on a scientific expedition that laid the foundations of oceanography.
events.subtitle: HMS Challenger (1858)
events.headline: HMS Challenger departs on scientific expedition from Portsmouth

events.originalText: The Rochdale Pioneers opened their store (pictured) in Rochdale, England, forming the basis for the modern co-operative movement.
events.subtitle: Rochdale Society of Equitable Pioneers
events.headline: Rochdale Pioneers open store in England, laying foundation for co-operative movement

events.originalText: Settlers from the United States in Mexican Texas made the first attempt to secede from Mexico, establishing the short-lived Republic of Fredonia.
events.subtitle: Mexican Texas
events.headline: Settlers in Mexican Texas attempt to secede, forming Republic of Fredonia

events.originalText: The Pilgrims aboard the Mayflower landed at present-day Plymouth, Massachusetts, to establish the Plymouth Colony.
events.subtitle: Pilgrims (Plymouth Colony)
events.headline: Pilgrims aboard Mayflower land in Plymouth, Massachusetts to establish colony

events.originalText: Lamberto Scannabecchi was elected pope, taking the name Honorius II.
events.subtitle: 1124 papal election
events.headline: Lamberto Scannabecchi elected pope, takes name Honorius II
